page.title: 09Manor Farm:Sheep
page.content:
{ {350 ewes}and their lambs graze 2nd-year leys;the first year being for the production of grass seed. The ewes are of mixed crosses, principally Clun Forest/ Suffolk and Mule. Suffolk rams are turned out with the ewes in late October for 6 weeks.
{Winter feeding}is provided from stubble turnips and afterwards, big bale silage and hay. Concentrates are fed from 6 weeks before lambing.
In mid-March the ewes are brought into a barn for{lambing.}They go out to graze when the lambs are 2 days old. Selection for market starts in mid-June.
